name: Lemon Balm
summary: Lemon balm (*Melissa officinalis*) is an herbal supplement traditionally used for calming, stress relief, and sleep support, with emerging evidence for its anxiolytic and cognitive effects.
description: Lemon balm is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and has been used for centuries as a calming herb. Its extracts and teas are commonly taken to reduce stress, ease anxiety, and promote sleep. Bioactive compounds, including rosmarinic acid, flavonoids, and terpenes, are thought to contribute to its effects on the central nervous system, including modulation of GABA receptors. Clinical studies suggest lemon balm may improve mood, reduce restlessness, and enhance cognitive performance under stress. It is generally well tolerated, with mild side effects such as nausea or dizziness reported occasionally.

metadata.fda_status: Dietary supplement (not FDA-approved for anxiety or insomnia)

contraindications: Allergy to plants in the mint family

sections.text: Lemon balm’s anxiolytic effects are attributed to its modulation of GABA-A receptors, increasing inhibitory neurotransmission. Rosmarinic acid and other flavonoids may also provide antioxidant and neuroprotective benefits. Some studies suggest cholinergic modulation, contributing to cognitive effects.

adult.range: Up to 1,600 mg/day in divided doses

sections.pediatric: Limited data; not routinely recommended without professional supervision

sections.text: Calming effects may appear within 1–2 hours of ingestion; sleep support benefits may take consistent nightly use.

other: May enhance sedative effects of other medications
Not a replacement for prescription anxiolytics in severe cases

sections.pregnancy: Limited safety data; avoid unless supervised
sections.pediatrics: Not well studied; tea occasionally used traditionally in small amounts

sections.text: No tapering required; discontinuation is generally well tolerated.

items: Best evidence is for mild anxiety and stress reduction, often in combination with other calming herbs.
May improve cognitive performance under stress by reducing restlessness and tension.
Typically used short-term for sleep support; long-term safety appears favorable.
